channel.title: Strategic Scrap RSS » Metal News
channel.description: Scrap Metal Industry News and Global Business News

item.title: Lucchini RS inaugurates new rolling line for train wheel production
item.dc:creator: SteelOrbis: steel news
item.description: Italian steelmaker Lucchini has inaugurated a new state-of-art rolling line for production of train wheels with an annual capacity of 100,000 units.
item.content:encoded: Italian steelmaker Lucchini has inaugurated a new state-of-art rolling line for production of train wheels with an annual capacity of 100,000 units.

item.title: Tenova Core supplies melt shop material handling system to Severstal NA
item.dc:creator: SteelOrbis: steel news
item.description: Tenova Core will supply a melt shop material handling system as part of the Severstal North America phase II project at its Columbus facility.
item.content:encoded: Tenova Core will supply a melt shop material handling system as part of the Severstal North America phase II project at its Columbus facility.

item.title: Tenova to supply 250 mt Consteel® EAF to Feida Group in China
item.dc:creator: SteelOrbis: steel news
item.description: China’s Beris has awarded a contract to Tenova for the supply of a 250 mt per hour Consteel® EAF for the new steel plant of Feida Group, China.
item.content:encoded: China’s Beris has awarded a contract to Tenova for the supply of a 250 mt per hour Consteel® EAF for the new steel plant of Feida Group, China.

item.title: Steel Industry Names David C. Jeanes, P.E. as Recipient of Market Development Lifetime Achievement Award
item.dc:creator: AISI News...
item.description: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that David C. Jeanes, P.E., president of the Steel Market Development Institute (retired), is the recipient of the 2010 Market Development Lifetime Achievement Award.
item.content:encoded: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that David C. Jeanes, P.E., president of the Steel Market Development Institute (retired), is the recipient of the 2010 Market Development Lifetime Achievement Award.

item.title: Steel Industry Announces Recipients of 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award
item.dc:creator: AISI News...
item.description: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that three individuals have received the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award? Edward G. Opbroek, director, WorldAutoSteel; Roger A. LaBoube, Ph.D., distinguished teaching professor, Department of Civil Engineering and director of the Wei-Wen Yu Center for Cold-Formed Steel Structures at the Missouri University of Science and Technology; and Julia Hurst, executive director, National Lieutenant Governors Association.
item.content:encoded: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that three individuals have received the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award? Edward G. Opbroek, director, WorldAutoSteel; Roger A. LaBoube, Ph.D., distinguished teaching professor, Department of Civil Engineering and director of the Wei-Wen Yu Center for Cold-Formed Steel Structures at the Missouri University of Science and Technology; and Julia Hurst, executive director, National Lieutenant Governors Association.

item.title: Steel Industry Announces Edward G. Opbroek of Worldautosteel as a Recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award
item.dc:creator: AISI News...
item.description: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that Edward G. Opbroek, director, WorldAutoSteel, is a recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award.
item.content:encoded: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that Edward G. Opbroek, director, WorldAutoSteel, is a recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award.

item.title: US DOC delays preliminary AD decision on certain carbon pipes and tubes from India
item.dc:creator: SteelOrbis: steel news
item.description: US DOC has postponed the deadline for its preliminary decision in the AD review on certain welded carbon steel standard pipes and tubes from India.
item.content:encoded: US DOC has postponed the deadline for its preliminary decision in the AD review on certain welded carbon steel standard pipes and tubes from India.

item.title: Steel Industry Announces Julia Hurst of National Lt. Governors Association as a Recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award
item.dc:creator: AISI News...
item.description: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that Julia Hurst, executive director, National Lieutenant Governors Association (NLGA), is a recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award.
item.content:encoded: Boca Raton, FL ? AISI?s Steel Market Development Institute (SMDI) announced today that Julia Hurst, executive director, National Lieutenant Governors Association (NLGA), is a recipient of the 2010 Market Development Industry Leadership Award.

item.title: Rio Tinto joins Australian miners concerned about proposed resources tax
item.dc:creator: SteelOrbis: steel news
item.description: Rio Tinto warned that the new Australian resources tax could erode Australia’s competitiveness, severely curtail investment and limit jobs growth.
item.content:encoded: Rio Tinto warned that the new Australian resources tax could erode Australia’s competitiveness, severely curtail investment and limit jobs growth.

item.title: Russia Suggests Gazprom Takes Over Ukrainian Gas System
item.dc:creator: stuart
item.description: Vladimir Putin is moving swiftly to consolidate Russia’s position in Ukraine following the election of a new government this year. The Russian leaning Mr Yanukovych has already agreed that Russia can keep its hugely valuable naval base on the Crimean Peninsula for a further 25 years. In return, Russia is said to have reduced the [...]

The Russian leaning Mr Yanukovych has already agreed that Russia can keep its hugely valuable naval base on the Crimean Peninsula for a further 25 years.
